Patient Information.Patient History: Diagnosed with arthritis 16 years ago, difficulty walking due to bilateral knee involvement, back pain, uses special shampoos for dandruff.
Patient Information.Review_of_Systems: Difficulty walking, frustration, improvement of pain with rest

Physical_Examination_Findings.System Examination: Physical examination is notable for pitting of his nails.

Patient Information.Patient History: Concerns about physical appearance since adolescence, targeted by classmates and coworkers, struggles with acne and unwanted facial hair, multiple unsuccessful attempts at diet and exercise, family history of type 2 diabetes mellitus, irregular menstrual cycle (every 45 days), recent glucose tolerance test showing plasma glucose level of 160 mg/dL after 2 hours of a 75 g dose of oral glucose.
Patient Information.Chief Complaint: Concerns about physical appearance, particularly acne and unwanted facial hair
Patient Information.Past_Medical_History: Family history of type 2 diabetes mellitus
Patient Information.Social_History: Visits to a local spa for facial hair, struggles with physical appearance

Physical_Examination_Findings.System Examination: Physical examination is notable for severe inflammatory acne over the cheeks and forehead and dark coarse hairs on the back.

Test_Results: Glucose tolerance test: plasma glucose level of 160 mg/dL (8.9 mmol/L) after 2 hours of a 75 g dose of oral glucose.

Patient Information.Patient History: The patient has a 6-week history of tingling pain in the sole of his right foot when raised above chest level during exercises, started exercising 2 months ago, right calf cramps when using the incline feature on the treadmill which forces frequent breaks, pain disappears after a few minutes of rest, 8-year history of type 2 diabetes mellitus, smokes two packs of cigarettes daily for 34 years, only medication is metformin.
Patient Information.Chief Complaint: Tingling pain in the sole of the right foot when raised above chest level during exercises and right calf cramping on treadmill incline
Patient Information.Secondary Symptoms: Pain disappears after resting for a few minutes
Patient Information.Social_History: Smokes two packs of cigarettes daily for 34 years
Patient Information.Review_of_Systems: No back pain, normal muscle strength.

Physical_Examination_Findings.System Examination: Straight leg raise test elicits pallor and tingling pain in the right foot. Femoral pulses are palpable; right pedal pulses are absent.

Test_Results: Physical examination notable for absence of right pedal pulses.
